title: President Trump makes some interesting allegations about Wisconsin's Republican voting history.
text: In the afternoon of June, President Donald Trump proudly presided over the new 10-billion-dollar Foxcon process in Mount Pleasant, Wes. In the midst of all this, Trump took a moment to pay tribute to his victory in 2016 in Wisconsin, a victory that was vital to securing the presidency. On June 28, 2018, Trump says, "it has not been won by a Republican since Dwight de Eisenhower, in 1952." He said, "I won Wisconsin. And I love Wisconsin so much, but we won Wisconsin. And Ronald Reagan, remember, Wisconsin was the state that Ronald Reagan didn't win." What did he say, Mr. President? According to the American presidency project, the following Republicans have won a presidential vote in Wisconsin since 1952: 1956: Dwight D. Eisenhower 1960: Richard M. Nixon By Bill McCarthy: January 12, 2021 1968: Richard M. Nixon 1972: Richard M. Nixon 1980: Ronald Reagan 1984: Ronald Reagan 2016: Donald Trump But it did not extend back to Eisenhower. And for the record, the only state that Reagan lost in 1984 was Minnesota's neighbor, not Wisconsin. Our evaluation of Trump says Wisconsin hasn't won it since Dwight de Eisenhower in 1952. "Wisconsin was the state that Ronald Reagan didn't win." Electoral records show that Trump is wrong in both cases. Very wrong.
